What book is The movie A Time for Dancing based on?

The movieA Time for Dancing is based on the bookA Time for Dancingwritten by  Davida Wills Hurwin

A Time for DancingPublished by Puffin - 1/1/1997

Seventeen-year-old best friends Samantha and Juliana tell their stories in alternating chapters after Juliana is diagnosed with cancer.

Related books / From the author(s)

A Time for Dancing

written byDavida Wills Hurwin

Published by Puffin - 1/1/1997

Seventeen-year-old best friends Samantha and Juliana tell their stories in alternating chapters after Juliana is diagnosed with cancer.

The Farther You Run

written byDavida Wills Hurwin

Published by Speak - 2/17/2005

Even with a new best friend and a new boyfriend, Samantha Russell has a hard time adjusting to life without her best friend Juliana, who died of cancer, in the sequel to A Time for Dancing. Reprint.

Freaks and Revelations

written byDavida Wills Hurwin

Published by Hachette UK - 11/4/2009

This raw, moving novel follows two teenagers-one, a Mohawk-wearing 17-year-old violent misfit; the other, a gay 13-year-old cast out by his family, hustling on the streets and trying to survive. Acclaimed author Davida Wills Hurwin creates a riveting narrative told in alternating perspectives of their lives before and after the violent hate crime that changed both their futures. This tragic but ultimately inspirational journey of two polarized teens, their violent first meeting, and their peaceful reunion years later is an unforgettable story of survival and forgiveness. This story is inspired by the real lives of Matthew Boger and Timothy Zaal, who have shared their story on The Oprah Winfrey Show and NPR.

Circle the Soul Softly

written byDavida Wills Hurwin

Published by Harper Collins - 3/17/2009

An elite school. Glamorous students who have fancy cars and mansions for homes (and all the haughty attitude to go with it). This is Katie O'Connor's fabulous new life since her family's recent move to Brentwood –– a perfect opportunity for a fresh start, at least in theory. The only time she can overlook the hostility of her classmates is when they share the stage for plays. Onstage, directed by her awesome drama teacher, Tess, she has the confidence and talent that she cannot seem to muster in her everyday life. And it doesn't hurt that one of Katie's fellow actors is smart and cute and interested in her. But beneath the glossy surface, there are secrets buried deep, even in Katie's own past. Nightmares and dark memories continue to plague Katie's consciousness, and in order to deal with the present, she needs to come to terms with the past. If only she could remember it.

Freaks and Revelations

written byDavida Wills Hurwin

Published by Little, Brown Books for Young Readers - 6/5/2012

This raw, moving novel follows two teenagers-one, a Mohawk-wearing 17-year-old violent misfit; the other, a gay 13-year-old cast out by his family, hustling on the streets and trying to survive. Acclaimed author Davida Wills Hurwin creates a riveting narrative told in alternating perspectives of their lives before and after the violent hate crime that changed both their futures. This tragic but ultimately inspirational journey of two polarized teens, their violent first meeting, and their peaceful reunion years later is an unforgettable story of survival and forgiveness. This story is inspired by the real lives of Matthew Boger and Timothy Zaal, who have shared their story on The Oprah Winfrey Show and NPR.

Did you know that the movie A Time for Dancing is based on the book A Time for Dancing?

Their love of dance, and their friendship, is challenged for two high school girls when one is diagnosed with cancer.

  • Internet Movie Database:  6.0/10
